Package dnl.node

Class Phase

  • java.lang.Object
    • dnl.node.Phase
  • public class Phase
extends java.lang.Object
    This represents a single signal phase. It stores the green, yellow, and all-red times, as well as a list of permitted turning movements.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Phase​(double green, double yellow, double red, java.util.List<Link[]> turnslist)

      Updates the start and end times given the specified start time.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Phase

        public Phase​(double green,
             double yellow,
             double red,
             java.util.List<Link[]> turnslist)

    • Method Detail

      • getStartTime

        public double getStartTime()
        Returns:
        the exogenously specified start time of this phase

      • getEndTime

        public double getEndTime()
        Returns:
        the exogenously specified end time of this phase

      • setStartTime

        public void setStartTime​(double start)
        Updates the start and end times given the specified start time. The end time is calculated based on the phase duration.

      • getDuration

        public double getDuration()
        Returns:
        the duration of this phase, which is the sum of the green, yellow, and all-red time.

      • getGreenDuration

        public double getGreenDuration​(double curr_time,
                               double end)
        Returns:
        the amount of green time if this phase were to be actuated from time curr_time to end. If the phase duration is too short, then a smaller green time will be returned.

      • getTurns

        public java.util.Map<Link,​java.util.List<Link>> getTurns()
        Returns:
        a map of turning movements permitted during this phase.
